body: Backing array is an Object[], without a class provided in the constructor T[] will not be able to be cast.  Probably best to use an Array internally, otherwise the class would have to be passed in.

Can not reproduce this issue, please add a www.sscce.org
Works fine here. At least what I tried worked fine.

issue.title: Avoid type-unaware Animation (fixes #4476)
issue.body:
Fixes #4476.

An animation instantiated with an Array was using a backing Object array instead of the correct array type, causing possible CCE when calling `getKeyFrames()` and assigning it to its expected type.

Now it uses the same backing type as the Array that's passed in, so as long as the Array was instantiated with a type parameter, you're good to go. I updated TextureAtlas to return type-aware arrays in `findRegions()` since this is a common source of animation frames.

body:
Sorry, my fault when I last updated Animation. 

Using an Array internally doesn't help because the internal Array would still need to be aware of the type. (Edit: Unless we changed the return type of `getKeyFrames()` to Array<T>, but I'm in favor of not making the class heavier and changing the API if it can be fixed a different way.)

Take a look at the PR. I updated it to use a correct type of backing array if the source Array was type aware, and I made `TextureAtlas.findRegions()` return a type-aware Array.

In this PR. the reason I didn't add a constructor to Animation that has a Class parameter is that Array already has that option, so there's no reason to clutter this class with two more constructors. But I did need to update TextureAtlas to return type-aware Arrays to take advantage of this.

issue.title: deps: upgrade libgdx to 1.9.5 by fixing Animation typing

repository.name: artemis-odb-contrib
repository.description: Drop-in extensions for artemis-odb. Prefab systems, components, networking, events!

issue.body:
it didn't compile with libgdx 1.9.5 or newer. Seems to be problematic with GWT builds (for me and here https://bitbucket.org/dermetfan/libgdx-utils/issues/18/not-compatible-with-gwt-html5-on-libgdx).

 Although, I'm not sure whether it'll work properly seeing this issue: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/4476

issue.title: animation.getKeyFrames().length throws Casting Exception
issue.body:
#### Issue details
Getting the length of the key frame array of an animation causes a Casting Exception.


#### Reproduction steps/code
```java
Array<TextureAtlas.AtlasRegion> regions = textureAtlas.findRegions("test");
Animation<TextureAtlas.AtlasRegion> animation = new Animation<>(.1f, regions, PlayMode.LOOP);
int i = animation.getKeyFrames().length;
```

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.6

#### Stacktrace
Error Message: 
```java
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.ClassCastException: [Ljava.lang.Object; cannot be cast to [Lcom.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas$AtlasRegion;
```

#### Please select the affected platforms
- probably all

body: I get the same exception with libGDX 19.6 .

Can confirm. :-( Problem only exists when Animation object was created with 
`Animation (float frameDuration, Array<? extends T> keyFrames)`

This PR was made after the 1.9.6 release. It won't show up until 1.9.7
unless you use the snapshot.
